subject: Polo
Selenium (Element)
Horses
Veterinary Medicine
lead_paragraph: An overdose of selenium most likely caused the death last week of 21 horses at the United States Open Polo Championship, Florida’s state veterinarian said. “Signs exhibited by the horses and their rapid deaths were consistent with toxic doses of selenium,” Thomas J. Holt, the state veterinarian, said in a statement.
